definitions.definition: the act of joining two or more organizations or businesses into one
definitions.sensetop: merger between/of A and Bmerger with something

examples.text: If the merger goes through, thousands of jobs will be lost.
a merger between the two banks
our proposed merger with the university
There are local companies ripe for merger or acquisition.
There has been a flurry of corporate mergers and acquisitions.
They completed a merger with Monsanto.
They threatened legal action to block the merger.

wordOrigin: early 18th cent.: from Anglo-Norman French merger (verb used as a noun): see merge.
